nanoindentation_methodology.equipment: MTS NanoIndenter® XP (MTS Corp., Eden Prairie, MN), equipped with the Continuous Stiffness Measurement (CSM) module
nanoindentation_methodology.indenter: three sided pyramidal Berkovich indenter with a sharp tip (end radius ~100 nm)
nanoindentation_methodology.calibration: fused silica standard, with elastic modulus (E=72 GPa) and hardness (H=9 GPa)
references: Tan, J. C.; Merrill, C. A.; Orton, J. B.; Cheetham, A. K. Acta Mater. 2009, 57, 3481.

high_pressure_synchrotron_single_crystal.equipment: Merrill-Bassett diamond anvil cell (DAC) equipped with 600 μm culet diamonds and a tungsten gasket
high_pressure_synchrotron_single_crystal.data_collection: Rigaku Saturn 724 CCD detector using synchrotron radiation (λ = 0.48590 Å) on beamline I19 at the Diamond Light Source, Rutherford Appleton Laboratory
high_pressure_synchrotron_single_crystal.pressure_range: ambient to 1.7 GPa for 1 and to 1.2 GPa for 2
high_pressure_synchrotron_single_crystal.results: only the unit cell parameters could be extracted
references: Merrill, L.; Bassett, W. A. Review of Scientific Instruments 1974, 45, 290.
Piermarini, G. J.; Block, S.; Barnett, J. D.; Forman, R. A. J. Appl. Phys. 1975, 46, 2774.

density_functional_theory_calculations.method: plane-wave pseudopotential method implemented in the CASTEP package based on the density functional theory (DFT)
density_functional_theory_calculations.pseudopotentials: Ultrasoft pseudopotentials with the 1s, 2s for C, N, and O treated as core electrons. For manganese, 3d and 4s electrons are chosen as the valence electrons.
density_functional_theory_calculations.U_energy: GGA+U method with the on-site orbital dependent Hubbard U energy of 4.0 eV for Mn
density_functional_theory_calculations.calculations: The energy of hydrogen bonding between the A-site amine cations and the [Mn­(HCOO)3]− framework was obtained from the total energy of the whole structure by subtracting the contributions of the A-site amine cations and anionic frameworks.
references: Payne, M. C.; Teter, M. P.; Allan, D. C.; Arias, T. A.; Joannopoulos, J. D. Rev. Mod. Phys. 1992, 64, 1045.
